results.title: The National driver's test
results.creator_credit: Vern Diamond, Warren V. Bush and CBS News (for Shell)
results.brief_description: Designed to test the viewer’s judgement, knowledge and perception as a driver. Emphasises the importance of anticipating the wrong actions of other drivers and the learning of “defensive” driving techniques. Includes section on high-speed highway accidents. Made with the co-operation of the National Safety Council (USA) and the IBM Corporation. Introduced briefly by Stuart Wagstaff.

results.title: The NABC's of basketball
results.brief_description: Five of America’s most respected and talented coaches analyse every aspect of the game of basketball. Lucius Mitchell examines the development of the big man; Bill Foster, the running game; Gene Barton relates the drills that his players use to develop individual offensive skills; Norm Stewart analyses the jump shot and one-hand free throw; Bobby Knight looks at team defence.

results.title: The Music of Erich Zann
results.creator_credit: John Strysik, Robert Rothman and Essential Saltes Productions
results.brief_description: Set in late nineteenth century Paris, the film follows the efforts of Charles Dexter Ward, a young American student, to make the acquaintance of an ageing musician who lives a secluded life in the room above him at a boarding house. Ward is fascinated, then driven to unravel the mysterious circumstances surrounding Zann and his music: he wants to learn why Zann plays wondrous, often awesomely compelling music late at night. Based on a short story by H.P. Lovecraft.

results.title: The Music child. Parts 1 and 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: David Allen Parry and David Parry Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the possibilities that exist for eliciting language, basic communication and relationship activity with handicapped children through a special type of music therapy based on live musical improvisation. Gives a comprehensive overview of this special technique in a wide variety of situations with children at various levels of development.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Allen Parry and David Parry Productions

results.title: The Munchers: a fable
results.brief_description: Animated clay figures representing teeth, plaque, bacteria, dental floss and the toothbrush present information on nutrition and dental health. The proper type of foods for optimum oral health is also discussed.

results.title: The Mountain
results.creator_credit: Martin McNamara, Claudio Romero Serafini, Stephen E Bettcher and Faces West Productions
results.brief_description: This modern fable is an allegory for a multitude of problem solving situations, ranging from substance abuse to social issues. It tells of a small village situated at the foot of “the Mountain” immersed in controversy through a rash of problems related to the mountain. The citizens frantically attempt a series of simplistic and ineffectual programs but these hasty measures only aggravate the problems and further divide the community. Finally reason prevails and the villagers calmly address their mountain related problems by seeking positive solutions.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin McNamara, Claudio Romero Serafini, Stephen E Bettcher and Faces West Productions

results.title: The Most
results.creator_credit: Gordon Sheppard, Richard Ballentine and Inter Video
results.brief_description: A study of Hugh Hefner, creator of the fantastically successful Playboy magazine and the Bunny Clubs. He is shown with his staff in his office, at a party in his own home, talking about his ideas and beliefs, and working alone at night in the deserted office building. Music by Dudley Moore. “The Playboy Twist” sung by Tommy Danton.

results.title: The Morning after = That extra effort
results.brief_description: A sales executive very much suffering from a hang-over attends a Marketing Meeting. The presentation announces high sales expectations for the coming period. The hung-over executive responds in various ways throughout the meeting.
